result.execSummary:
The defendant Cedric Pugh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample. Pay all mandatory costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DNA surcharges, court costs and fees by August 15th, 2022. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. All non-mandatory costs are waived due to inability to pay.
- Restitution set at $0.00.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Court finds the defendant IS eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program on count 1 after serving 2 YEARS of initial confinement.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 2, consecutive to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
- No possession of firearms, ammunition or magazines.
- Not to be in any automobile where a firearm is present.

- Complete a minimum of 1 sobriety support meeting per week.
- Complete a Mental Health Evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment; to include a Trauma Evaluation and Trauma Informed Care.

- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes: Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 1, consecutive to any other sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cedric Pugh

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of PLEA & SENTENCING HEARING (48 pages) commencing 06-22-22 by KRISTIN MENZIA.

Defendant Cedric Pugh in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Cedric Pugh in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.

Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1 and 2.  

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Case proceeded to sentencing hearing. Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 6 YEARS, concurrent to COUNT 2, consecutive to any other sentence. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 3 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 2: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 YEARS, concurrent to COUNT 1, consecutive to any other sentence. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Complete a minimum of 1 sobriety support meeting per week.
- No possession of firearms, ammunition or magazines. 
- Not to be in any automobile where a firearm is present.
- Complete a mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment; to include a trauma evaluation and trauma informed care.
- Provide a DNA sample. 

-- Pay all MANDATORY costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DNA surcharges, court costs and fees by August 15th, 2022. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- All non mandatory costs are waived due to inability to pay.

*Court sets restitution and fines at $0.00.
*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program 
*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program on COUNT 1 after serving 2 YEARS of initial confinement.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

*Court is withholding decision on credit time and sets deadline of 06/29/2022 for defense to file written document regarding credit and communication with the Department of Corrections. Court to submit written order after deadline. 

Filed: 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights/Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.
Jury instructions for plea hearing.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief.

Defendant Cedric Pugh in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Cedric Pugh in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for a plea and sentencing hearing. Defense was unable to contact defendant to go through plea forms. Court orders that defendant remain at Milwaukee County for another night to accomodate new plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Received and filed a letter from defendant.  DK
RETURN ADDRESS: #150929  JACKSON CORRECTIONAL INST.
P.O. BOX 233  / X-BLDG  BLACK RIVER FALLS, WI 54615

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Cedric Pugh not in court, in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense requested a plea and sentencing date. Court set the following filing deadline. Parties have until June 21st, 2022 to file and plea and sentencing documents. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Cedric Pugh not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Court sets a discovery deadline for the State of 4/15/22 with the exception of any crime lab reports. Any motions to be filed by 5/6/22. Any change of plea forms to be filed no later than 5/17/22.  Case is adjourned to Br. 17.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Cedric Pugh in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Cedric Pugh in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cedric Pugh appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Cedric Pugh in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Cedric Pugh in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cedric Pugh appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
